text: The Diocese of Guadalcanal is one of the nine current dioceses of the Anglican Church of Melanesia. It was founded on 23 June 2013. The diocese was erected from the Diocese of Central Solomons and inaugurated at St Paul's Chapel, Legalau village, Tasiboko; it covers an area from beyond Lunga Bridge on the east and to beyond White River Bridge on the west of Honiara. St Paul's Chapel has become the diocesan cathedral. ==List of bishops== {| class="wikitable" style="width: 95%;" |- ! colspan="4" style="background-color: #7F1734; color: white;" | Bishops of Guadalcanal |- ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 8%;" | From ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 8%;" | Until ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 33%;" | Incumbent ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 46%;" | Notes |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 2013 | style="text-align: center;" | present | Nathan Tome | First bishop; elected 6 September 2013; translated from Banks and Torres; acting primate 2015–2016. |} ==References== ==Sources== *Anglican Church of Melanesia — Diocese of Guadalcanal Guadalcanal, Diocese of Category:Melanesia Category:Christian organizations established in 2013 Category:2013 establishments in Oceania Category:Bishops of Guadalcanal
title: Diocese of Guadalcanal
